oai_dc:dc.dc:title: McDonald, Donald
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Donald McDonald, a civil engineer with degrees from Auburn University in Alabama and the University of Illinois, led AUC through continued expansion and recognition. He served as a faculty member for 17 years at Texas A&M, and in 1979, was appointed head of civil engineering there. After that, he became provost, then vice president for academic affairs. McDonald had international academic experience before coming to AUC and established a Texas A&M branch campus in Japan. He served as president from 1990 to 1997.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: presidents; administrators
